Narrative WQGs: Unrestricted change permitted withn this pH range.  The component of the freshwater WQGs should be used cautiously if the pH change causes the carbon dioxide concentrations to exceed a 10 umol/L minimum or a 1360 umol/L short-term.  Carbon dioxide concentrations below 10 umol/L can cause a shift in the phytoplankton community to cyanobacteria, while carbon dioxide concentrations above 1360 umol/L can be toxic to fish.
Reference: B.C. Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy

Narrative Conditions: Total sulphide = dissolved H2S + HS + acid-soluble metal sulphides present in suspended matter. Dissolved sulphide is that remaining after suspended solids have been removed after flocculation or settling. In aquatic environments, H2S and HS are in equilibrium as H2S = H+ + HS-. The un-ionized H2S can be calculated from dissolved sulphide, the sample pH and the ionization constant (which is dependent on the sample water temperature) of H2S.
Reference: US Environmental Protection Agency. 1976. Quality criteria for water. Washington, DC (US): Office of Water Regulations and Standards, July 1976. 534 p. (The Red Book).
